metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12389 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox ESR 60.2. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memorycorruption and we presume that with enough effort that some of these couldbe exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR< 60.3 and Thunderbird < 60.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12389` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.4.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
